messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html File doc/codelab/wiki/index.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode27 doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:27: At present, you need to have a Linux, OS X, FreeBSD or Windows machine to run Go. FreeBSD first, alphabetically. http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode82 doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:82: (See Effective Go instead of effective go, refer to /doc/articles/slices_usage_and_internals.html http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode210 doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:210: wiki (we will use the Unix style from now on, Windows user please How about this instead $ go build wiki.go $ ./wiki Thi sis a sample page

(If you're using a Windows system you must type "wiki" without the "./" to run the program.)

PTAL. On 2012/02/23 01:19:44, adg wrote: > http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html > File doc/codelab/wiki/index.html (right): > > http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode27 > doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:27: At present, you need to have a Linux, OS X, > FreeBSD or Windows machine to run Go. > FreeBSD first, alphabetically. Done > http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode82 > doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:82: (See href="/doc/effective_go.html#slices">Effective Go > instead of effective go, refer to /doc/articles/slices_usage_and_internals.html Done. > > http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076/diff/5010/doc/codelab/wiki/index.html#newcode210 > doc/codelab/wiki/index.html:210: wiki (we will use the Unix style > from now on, Windows user please > How about this instead > > $ go build wiki.go > $ ./wiki > Thi sis a sample page > > >

> (If you're using a Windows system you must type "wiki" without the > "./" to run the program.) >

Done.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=001ee6ea5ffa ***

doc: update codelab/wiki to Go 1.

R=golang-dev, r, adg
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5683076

subject: code review 5683076: doc: update codelab/wiki to Go 1.
